title: How to Make Avocado Chicken Salad

methods.name: Mixing Up Simple Avocado Chicken Salad

steps.headline: Cut the chicken breasts into pieces.
steps.description: For the salad, you'll need 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts that have already been cooked. Use a sharp knife to chop the chicken into ½-inch (1.27-cm) cubes, and set aside for the moment. If you don't have leftover chicken breasts, you can use store-bought rotisserie chicken, remove the meat from the bone, and chop it into pieces.

steps.headline: Mash the avocado.
steps.description: Place 1 ripe avocado that's been seeded and peeled into a large bowl. Use a fork to mash the avocado until it is mostly smooth. It's important to work quickly as you mash the avocado and begin to mix the salad. Avocado can brown very quickly.

steps.headline: Mix in the lime juice.
steps.description: Once you've mashed the avocado, add 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of lime juice to the bowl. Use the fork to stir the juice into the avocado until they are well blended. Adding the lime juice helps keep the avocado from browning because the acid in the juice helps lower the avocado's pH.

steps.headline: Stir in the tomatoes, onions, and chicken.
steps.description: After you've combined the avocado and lime juice, add half a small onion that's been chopped, 8 grape tomatoes that have been sliced in half, and the diced chicken to the bowl. Use the fork to toss all of the ingredients together so they're lightly coated with the avocado mixture. If there are other vegetables that you'd like to add to the salad, such as chopped celery, mix them in with onion and tomatoes.

steps.headline: Season the salad with salt and serve.
steps.description: When the salad is fully mixed, add as much salt as you like to season it. You can eat the avocado chicken salad straight from the bowl or use it as a filling for sandwiches. Store any leftover salad in the refrigerator in an airtight container. It should keep for 1 to 2 days.

methods.name: Preparing Avocado Chicken Salad with Mustard

steps.headline: Mash the avocado and lime juice.
steps.description: Add half a medium ripe avocado that's been seeded and peeled and the juice from half a lime to a small bowl. Use a fork to mash the two together so they are fully mixed. The recipe is easy to double, so feel free to make a larger batch if you're preparing lunch for a group.

steps.headline: Stir in the mustard, garlic, and other seasonings.
steps.description: Once the avocado and lime juice are mixed, add 1 to 2 teaspoons (5 to 10 g) of coarse brown mustard, ½ teaspoon (1 ½ g) of garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste to the bowl. Mix well with the fork so the seasonings are fully incorporated. The mustard helps the avocado bind the salad together, but it also adds flavor. If you want a stronger mustard flavor, add the full 2 teaspoons (10 g).

steps.headline: Mix in the chicken and vegetables.
steps.description: When the avocado mixture is properly seasoned, add 1 cup (140 g) of chopped, cooked chicken breast and ½ cup (75 g) of your favorite chopped vegetables to the bowl. Use the fork to mix the chicken and veggies in so they're fully incorporated. You can use whatever chopped vegetables you like, but carrots, cabbage, and radishes are good options. Stick to one vegetable, or mix in a combination of your favorites.

steps.headline: Serve the salad on your favorite bread.
steps.description: After you've fully mixed the salad, spread it on your favorite bread or inside a pita to make a sandwich. You can also put it on crackers or dip vegetables into it. If you have leftover salad that you plan to store in the refrigerator, place the avocado seed in an airtight container with the salad. That will slow down the browning of the avocado.

methods.name: Whipping Up Avocado Chicken Salad with Apple

steps.headline: Mash the avocado.
steps.description: Add 1 ripe avocado that's been seeded and peeled to a medium bowl. With a fork, mash the avocado until it is mostly smooth.

steps.headline: Mix in the chicken, apple, celery, and onion.
steps.description: Once the avocado is smooth, add 1 cup (140 g) of finely chopped, cooked chicken, 1 apple that's been peeled, cored, and finely chopped, ¼ cup (55 g) of finely chopped celery, and ¼ cup (40 g) of finely chopped red onion to the bowl. Stir the mixture well with the fork so all of the ingredients are fully combined. Any type of apple will work in the salad. If there are other vegetables that you like, feel free to mix them into the salad.

steps.headline: Stir in the cilantro, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
steps.description: After you've mixed the chicken, fruit, and veggies into the avocado, add 2 tablespoons (6 g) of finely chopped cilantro, 2 teaspoons (10 ml) of lime juice, ½ teaspoon (3 g) of kosher salt, and a pinch of freshly ground black pepper to the bowl. Use the fork to mix well until the ingredients are fully incorporated. You can substitute a 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of lemon juice for the lime juice if you prefer. You can substitute chopped parsley for the cilantro if you prefer. If the salad seems too dry, you can mix in 1 to 2 teaspoons (5 to 10 ml) of olive oil to loosen it.

steps.headline: Serve the salad on bread or greens.
steps.description: When the salad is fully mixed, spread it over your favorite sandwich bread or toast. You can also serve the salad on top of a bed of greens, such as arugula or watercress. Store any leftover avocado chicken salad in a bowl, and cover it tightly with plastic wrap so none of it is exposed to the air. It should keep for 1 to 2 days in the refrigerator.

methods.name: Putting Together Avocado Chicken Salad with Mayo and Yogurt

steps.headline: Combine all of the ingredients except the chicken.
steps.description: Add 1 ripe avocado that's been seeded and peeled, ½ teaspoon (1 ½ g) of garlic powder, ½ teaspoon (3 g) of salt, ½ teaspoon (1 g) of pepper, 2 teaspoons (10 ml) of lime juice, 1 teaspoon (2 g) of fresh cilantro, ¼ cup (58 g) of mayonnaise, and ¼ cup (71 g) of plain Greek yogurt to a large bowl. Mix the ingredients well with a fork until they are fully combined. You can add vegetables, such as chopped onion or celery, if you'd like.

steps.headline: Mix in the chicken.
steps.description: Once all of the other ingredients are mixed, add 2 cups (280 g) of shredded chicken to the bowl. Stir the mixture well until it's completely incorporated. You can use leftover chicken or purchase a rotisserie chicken and shred the meat from it.

steps.headline: Cover the salad and refrigerate for a half hour.
steps.description: After the salad is completely mixed, cover the bowl tightly with plastic wrap. Place it the refrigerator and allow it to chill for at least 20 to 30 minutes so the flavors have time to meld together. For the best flavor, it's best not to chill the salad for more than 24 hours.

steps.headline: Spread the salad over bread or crackers.
steps.description: Once the avocado chicken salad has been chilled for a while, use it as a filling for your favorite sandwich bread or pita pocket. You can also serve it with crackers or on a bed of lettuce.
